definition: to be as good as one's word (idiom)/to keep one's promise
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Then, true to their word, they showed up – just as police were coming to greet them.
sentences.chinese: 说到做到，信守诺言，他们露面时，警察恭候在银行。

sentences.english: I ran for President promising transparency, and I meant what I said.
sentences.chinese: 我在竞选总统时承诺要做到透明化，我说到做到。

sentences.english: I'm not one to mess with.
sentences.chinese: 我说到做到，你们不要惹我。

sentences.english: When it’s all said and done, your success will depend on how well you played the game.
sentences.chinese: 说到做到，你的成功就在于你怎么玩好这个游戏。

sentences.english: This time we definitely mean it.
sentences.chinese: 这次，我们绝对说到做到。

definition: to do as promised/to be as good as one's word/to honor one's word/to mean what one says
to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
to speak and keep one's promise (idiom); as good as one's word
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
a promise worth one thousand in gold (idiom); a promise that must be kept
promises must be kept
one word worth nine sacred tripods (idiom); words of enormous weight
lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom)/fig. not to live up to one's promises
to go back on one's word/to break one's promise/to be unfaithful/to be untrustworthy
a nobleman's word is his bond (proverb)
pinyin: jun1 zi3 yi1 yan2 , si4 ma3 nan2 zhui1

definition: (idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
oath/vow/to swear/to pledge
daring to act and courageous enough to take responsibility for it/a true man has the courage to accept the consequences of his actions/the buck stops here
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
to give orders/to spread news or rumors/to leak certain information intentionally
